text: So a couple years ago, a woman I know who I'll call Maya went through a lot of big changes  in a short amount of time.
summary: a couple years ago, a woman I know who I'll call Maya went through a lot of big changes in a short amount of time.

text: She got married, she and her husband moved for his job to a new city where she didn't  know anyone.
summary: she got married, she moved for his job to a new city where she didn't know anyone .

text: She started a new role working from home, all while managing her dad's new diagnosis  of dementia.
summary: she started a new role working from home, all while managing her dad's diagnosis of dementia .

text: And to manage the stress of all this change, Maya doubled down on her physical and mental  health.
summary: Maya doubles down on her physical and mental health . she manages the stress of all this change .

text: She exercised almost every day, she ate healthy foods, she went to therapy once a week. And these actions really helped, her body got stronger, her mind got more resilient,  but only up to a point.
summary: she exercised almost every day, ate healthy foods, went to therapy once a week . her body got stronger, her mind got more resilient, but only up to a point .

text: She was still struggling, often losing sleep in the middle of the night, feeling unfocused,  unmotivated during the day.
summary: she was still struggling, often losing sleep in the middle of the night . she felt unfocused and unmotivated during the day .

text: Maya was doing everything that doctors typically tell us to do to be physically and mentally  healthy and yet something was missing.
summary: Maya was doing everything doctors typically tell us to do to be physically and mentally healthy . but something was missing .

text: What if I told you that what was missing for Maya is also missing for billions of people  around the world and that it might be missing for you?
summary: what was missing for Maya is also missing for billions of people around the world . what if i told you that it might be missing for you?

text: What if I told you that not having it undermines our other efforts to be healthy and can even  shorten your lifespan?
summary: what if I told you that not having it undermines our other efforts to be healthy and can even shorten your lifespan?

text: I've been studying this for over a decade and I've discovered that the traditional  way we think about health is incomplete.
summary: the traditional way we think about health is incomplete . I've been studying this for over a decade .

text: By thinking of our health as primarily physical and mental, we overlook what I believe is  the greatest challenge and the greatest opportunity of our time.
summary: thinking of our health as primarily physical and mental, we overlook what I believe is the greatest challenge and the greatest opportunity of our time .

text: Social health. While physical health is about our bodies and mental health is about our minds, social  health is about our relationships.
summary: physical health is about our bodies and mental health is over our minds . social health also about our relationships .

text: And if you haven't heard this term before, that's because it hasn't yet made its way  into mainstream vocabulary yet it is equally important.
summary: this term hasn't yet made its way into mainstream vocabulary yet it is equally important .

text: Maya didn't yet have a sense of community in her new home.
summary: maya didn't yet have a sense of community in her new home . her new house has a thriving community . she is currently in the u.s.

text: She wasn't seeing her family or friends or her coworkers in person anymore and she often  went weeks only spending quality time with her husband.
summary: she often went weeks only spending quality time with her husband . she wasn't seeing her family, friends or coworkers in person anymore .

text: Her story shows us that we can't be fully healthy.
summary: her story shows us that we can't be fully healthy . she tells us that she isn't healthy enough .

text: We can't thrive if we take care of our bodies and our minds but not our relationships.
summary: we can't thrive if we take care of our bodies and our minds but not our relationships .

text: Similar to Maya, hundreds of millions of people around the world go weeks at a time without  talking to a single friend or family member.
summary: hundreds of millions of people go weeks at a time without talking to a single friend or family member .

text: Globally, one in four people feel lonely and 20% of adults worldwide don't feel like they  have anyone they can reach out to for support.
summary: one in four people feel lonely and 20% of adults worldwide don't feel like they have anyone they can reach out to for support .

text: Think about that.
summary: think about that . if you are thinking about that, think about it in the comments below .

text: One in five people you encounter may feel like they have no one.
summary: 1 in five people you encounter may feel like they have no one . one in five may feel as if they aren't there .

text: This is more than heartbreaking.
summary: this is more than heartbreaking . it's a heartbreaking story . this is the most heartbreaking thing .

text: It's also a public health crisis.
summary: it's also a public health crisis, which is also affecting public health . there are a number of public health issues in the country .

text: Disconnection triggers stress in the body.
summary: disconnection triggers stress in the body . the body is unable to cope with stress .

text: It weakens people's immune systems. It puts them at a risk, greater risk of stroke, heart disease, diabetes, dementia, depression,  and early death.
summary: it puts people at a risk, greater risk of stroke, heart disease, diabetes, dementia, depression, and early death .

text: Social health is essential for longevity.
summary: social health is essential for longevity . social health has a vital role in extending lifespan .

text: So you might be wondering, what does it look like to be socially healthy?
summary: what does it look like to be socially healthy? if you are a socially-healthian, you might be wondering .

text: What does that even mean?
summary: what does that even mean? what is that even a little bit of a slur?

text: Well, it's about developing close relationships with your family or friends, your partner,  yourself. It's about having regular interaction with your coworkers or neighbors.
summary: it's about developing close relationships with your family or friends, your partner, yourself . you'll have regular interaction with your coworkers or neighbors .

text: It's about feeling like you belong to a community.
summary: it's about feeling like you belong to a community . it is about expressing yourself as a member .

text: Having socially healthy is about having the right quantity and quality of connection for  you.
summary: Having socially healthy is about having the right quantity and quality of connection for you .

text: My story is one example of how social health challenges come up.
summary: my story is one example of how social health challenges come up . social health issues come up with a number of challenges .

text: In my work, I hear many others.
summary: in my work, I hear many others . i hear a lot of others.

text: Stories like Jay, a freshman in college who's eager to get involved in campus yet is having  a hard time sitting in with people on his dorm and often feels homesick.
summary: Jay, a freshman in college who's eager to get involved in campus yet is having a hard time sitting in with people on his dorm .

text: For Serena and Ali, a couple juggling the chaos of young kids with demanding jobs, they  rarely have time to see friends or spend time one-on-one.
summary: serena and Ali juggling the chaos of young kids with demanding jobs . they rarely have time to see friends or spend time one-on-one .

text: Or Henry, recently retired, who cherishes time with his spouse and yet feels untethered  without his team anymore and wishes he could see his kids and grandkids more often.
summary: or Henry, recently retired, cherishes time with his spouse and yet feels untethered without his team anymore and wishes he could see his kids and grandkids more often .

text: These stories show that social health is relevant to each of us at every life stage.
summary: these stories show that social health is relevant to each of us at every life stage . social health has a profound impact on our lives .

text: If you're not sure where to start, try the 531 guideline from my book.
summary: if you're not sure where to start, try the 531 guideline from my book.

text: It goes like this.
summary: it goes like this . it is a good thing to do . if you're a fan of this, click here for all the latest .

text: Aim to interact with five different people each week to strengthen at least three close  relationships overall and to spend one hour a day connecting.
summary: Aim to interact with five different people each week to strengthen at least three close relationships overall and to spend one hour a day connecting.

text: Let's dig into these.
summary: let's dig into these . here's a look at the top 10 .

text: So first, interact with five different people each week.
summary: first, interact with five different people each week . interact with 5 different people a week.

text: Just like eating a variety of vegetables and other food groups is more nutritious, research  has shown that interacting with a variety of people is more rewarding.
summary: research has shown that interacting with a variety of people is more rewarding than eating vegetables and other food groups .

text: So your five could include close loved ones, casual acquaintances, even complete strangers.
summary: your five could include close loved ones, casual acquaintances, even complete strangers . if you're a close friend, consider a friend or a stranger .

text: In fact, in one study that I love, people who just smiled, made eye contact and chit-chatted  with a barista felt happier and a greater sense of belonging than people who just rushed  to get their coffee and go.
summary: people who just smiled, made eye contact and chit-chatted with a barista felt happier and a greater sense of belonging than those who just rushed to get their coffee and go .

text: Next, strengthen at least three close relationships.
summary: bolster at least three close relationships . if you have a close relationship, it's a good idea to strengthen the relationship .

text: Okay, we've all heard of a to-do list, but I would like to invite you to write a to-love list.
summary: we've all heard of a to-do list, but I would like to invite you to write a list.

text: Who matters most to you?
summary: who matters most to you? . . what matters most? if you are a seasoned entrepreneur, .

text: Who can you be yourself with?
summary: who can you be yourself with? if you can't be yourself, you can be yourself .

text: Make sure that you invest in the names of at least three of the people that you write down  by scheduling regular time together, by showing a genuine interest in their lives and also  by opening up about the experiences that you're going through.
summary: make sure that you invest in the names of at least three people that you write down by scheduling regular time together . show a genuine interest in their lives and open up about the experiences that you're going through .

text: And I'm often asked, does it have to be in person?
summary: i'm often asked, does it have to be in person? I'm always asked, is it in person ?

text: Does texting count?
summary: texting counts? Does texting count? is texting a sign-up count?

text: Studies have shown that face-to-face is ideal, so do that whenever possible, but there are  absolutely still benefits to staying connected virtually.
summary: studies have shown that face-to-face is ideal, so do that whenever possible, but there are absolutely still benefits to staying connected virtually .

text: And last, spend one hour a day on meaningful connection.
summary: spend one hour a day on meaningful connection . spend a week on meaningful connections .

text: Okay, if you're an introvert, right now you're probably thinking one hour sounds like a lot.
summary: introverts think one hour sounds like a lot if you're an introvert .

text: I get it.
summary: i get it . i got it. . I get it. I'm a good guy.

text: Might be surprising, but I'm actually also an introvert.
summary: I'm also an introvert . he's a big fan of the introverts.

text: However, keep in mind that just like getting eight hours of sleep at night, the exact amount  that's right for you personally might be higher or lower.
summary: keep in mind that just like getting eight hours of sleep at night, the exact amount that's right for you personally might be higher or lower .

text: But if you're thinking that one hour a day sounds like way too much because you're just  way too busy, I challenge you.
summary: one hour a day sounds like way too much because you're just way too busy .

text: Adults in the US spend an average of four and a half hours each day on their smartphones.
summary: adults spend an average of four and a half hours each day on their smartphones .

text: So instead of scrolling on social media, text a friend.
summary: instead of scrolling on social media, text a friend . text your friend a message .

text: Instead of reading news headlines, write a thank you card.
summary: write a thank you card instead of reading news headlines . use the form below to send your thank you cards .

text: Instead of listening to a podcast, call a family member.
summary: call a family member instead of listening to a podcast . call the family member a 'family member'

text: Maya put this into practice by scheduling recurring hangouts with a new local friend  that she made, by attending community events and dropping cards off in her neighbor's mailboxes,  by planning trips to see family and inviting friends in other cities to come visit.
summary: maya put this into practice by scheduling recurring hangouts with a new local friend that she made, by attending community events and dropping cards off in her neighbor's mailboxes .

text: And bolstering her social health made more of a difference than focusing solely on her  physical and mental health ever could.
summary: bolstering social health made more of a difference than focusing solely on her physical and mental health ever could .

text: And I know this because Maya is actually me.
summary: Maya is actually me, and I know this because I know it because I am actually me.

text: I am so passionate about sharing tools to be socially healthy because honestly I need  them to.
summary: i am so passionate about sharing tools to be socially healthy because honestly I need them to .

text: And the 531 guideline is one way that we can be proactive and intentional about our relationships.
summary: 531 guideline is one way that we can be proactive and intentional about our relationships .

text: And that is really the point, be proactive and intentional about your social health. So zooming out beyond the steps that you and I take individually, together we need to shape  a society that provides through social health. Over the next decade, I envision educators championing social health in schools.
summary: be proactive and intentional about your social health . over the next decade, I envision educators championing social health in schools .

text: And just like kids build their physical muscles in gym class, they'll exercise their social  muscles in connection class.
summary: like kids build their physical muscles in gym class, they'll exercise their social muscles in connection class .

text: Over the next decade, I see our cities and neighborhoods being designed with social  health in mind, where vibrant gathering places foster unity and community builders are empowered  to bring them to life. Over the next decade, I believe that social health will become as ingrained in our collective  consciousness as mental health is today.
summary: social health will become as ingrained in our collective consciousness as mental health is today . over the next decade, I see our cities and neighborhoods being designed with social health in mind .

text: Because not that long ago, mental health was a taboo topic shrouded in stigma.
summary: mental health was a taboo topic shrouded in stigma . because not that long ago, mental health had been a topic .

text: And now public figures talk openly about it, there's an entire industry to support it,  and more and more people think of going to therapy like going to the gym.
summary: public figures talk openly about it, there's an entire industry to support it . more and more people think of going to therapy like going to the gym .

text: In this future, loneliness will subside, just like smoking subsided when you recognized  and treated it as a public health issue.
summary: loneliness will subside in this future, just like smoking subsided when you recognized and treated it as a public health issue .

text: In this future, I hope that social health will become so deeply woven into the fabric  of our culture that no one needs the 531 guideline.
summary: social health will become so deeply woven into the fabric of our culture that no one needs the 531 guideline .

text: So to get there, make relationships your priority.
summary: to get there, make relationships your priority . make relationships a priority for you .

text: Not only for you, but also for the people you love.
summary: the people you love are not only for you, but also for the people who you love .

text: Because the beauty of nurturing your own social health is that it naturally enriches the social  health of everyone you connect with.
summary: the beauty of nurturing your own social health is that it naturally enriches the social health of everyone you connect with.

text: Thank you.
summary: thank you for your support. thank you if you have any questions? click here for all the latest .
